Skiing is believed to have been invented by prehistoric people in northern Europe around 5000 BC. Snowboarding was invented in the 1960s and became an Olympic sport in 1998.

The sport of snowboarding was invented in 1965 when Sherman Poppen, an engineer from Muskegon, Michigan, created a toy for his daughters by fastening two skis together and attaching a rope to one end so he could tow his daughters around their yard.
